Glossary

A quick-reference of Amplifier terms used throughout the book. Most definitions link to a deeper explanation page.

Jump to A B C H M O P R T

A

Amplifier core (kernel)
The small, stable runtime library: session orchestration plumbing, hook/event mechanism, module contracts, and provider request/response envelopes. See amplifier-core & foundation.
Amplifier foundation (library)
The foundational library that provides the bundle system, module resolution, source management, and shared utilities. Consolidates functionality previously split across amplifier-profiles, amplifier-collections, amplifier-config, and amplifier-module-resolution. See amplifier-core & foundation.
Application (app)
A consumer of the Amplifier ecosystem: CLI, web UI, service, daemon, benchmark runner, etc. Apps assemble a mount plan and create sessions. See amplifier-core & foundation.

B

Bundle
Current configuration system. A composable packaging unit from amplifier-foundation that combines a mount plan (session + providers/tools/hooks/agents) with resources (context files, agent markdown, examples). Bundles can include other bundles and can be prepared for execution (downloading/activating module sources). Bundles replace the deprecated profile/collection system. See Bundles and amplifier-core & foundation.

C

Collection (deprecated)
Deprecated - replaced by bundles. A packaged "domain bundle" distributed separately, containing profiles, agents, prompts/context, and related resources. Collections can be installed/updated and then discovered by the app. See Collections (archived) and Migration guide.
Context manager
A module responsible for storing conversation state (as dicts), and for compaction when needed. See Modules.

H

Hook
A lifecycle middleware module. Hooks can observe, deny, modify event data, inject context, or request user approval. See Hooks.

M

Module
A dynamically loaded plugin implementing a stable contract (provider/tool/hook/orchestrator/context). Modules are mounted into an AmplifierSession. See Modules.
Module resolution
The policy for deciding where modules come from (workspace overrides, settings, profile hints, installed packages, etc.). See Module resolution.
Mount plan
The configuration dict that tells a session what to mount: orchestrator, context manager, providers, tools, hooks (and app-level agent overlays). Profiles compile into mount plans; bundles compile into mount plans. See Profiles and amplifier-core & foundation.

O

Orchestrator (loop)
The module that defines “how the agent runs”: how prompts, tool calls, provider calls, and hooks are sequenced. See Modules.

P

Profile (deprecated)
Deprecated - replaced by bundles. A declarative configuration (with inheritance) that compiles into a mount plan: which modules to mount and how to configure them. See Profiles (archived) and Migration guide.
Provider
A module that talks to a model backend. Providers receive a typed request envelope and return a typed response. See Modules.

R

Recipe
Declarative YAML specification that orchestrates multi-step AI agent workflows with sequential execution, context accumulation, and automatic checkpointing for resumability. See Recipes.

T

Tool
A callable capability (filesystem, bash, web, etc.) exposed to the orchestrator/model and returning a typed ToolResult. See Modules.
